{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3524371,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-12T02:39:33.021Z","cooked":"

Our team has plenty of experience using the REV Through Bore encoder in absolute mode, but we are struggling to use it in alternate mode. We keep getting a start competition error telling us our board is not compatible.

java.lang.IllegalStateException: The SPARK MAX is not configured to use an alternate encoder.  com.revrobotics.spark.SparkMax.checkDataPortAlternateEncoder(SparkMax.java:124)

We have the switch on the encoder set to “A”, we are using the alternate encoder board adapter on our SparkMAX, we set the SparkMax to use an alternate encoder in the REV hardware client, we are just not sure where to go from here. We are able to see the absolute value just fine when we are configured for it.

One thing to note, our input voltage is high whenever we plug the encoder into the breakout board. The SparkMAX reports anywhere from 16.5 to 17.5 volts when the board is plugged in. Perhaps there is an issue with this?

Here is our code in addition: 2025-Reefscape-Competition/src/main/java/frc/robot/subsystems/ElevatorSubsystem.java at main · FRC3546/2025-Reefscape-Competition · GitHub

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-12T11:41:48.847Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":7,"reads":105,"readers_count":104,"score":56.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491304,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-working-in-alternate-mode","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/absolute-mode-and-alternate-mode-on-rev-through-bore-encoder/493116/3","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Absolute Mode and Alternate Mode on REV Through Bore Encoder","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":39084,"username":"TFM110","name":"Tauseef Afraz","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tfm110/{size}/197758_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-working-in-alternate-mode/491304/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3532658,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-19T12:44:45.453Z","cooked":"

Here is what we did to solve this issue. It primarily lies in the REV configuration, which is not well documented as of now. To put our encoder in alternate mode these are the steps:

  1. Move the through bore encoder switch into the “A” position
  2. Move the alternate encoder break out board switch into the “ABS PWM” position
  3. Make sure encoder board is connected fully (we also recommend hot-melting the board to the SparkMAX)
  4. You need to configure the attached encoder with a SparkMAX Config. This is what we did:
backElevatorMotorConfig.alternateEncoder
                .countsPerRevolution(8192)
                .setSparkMaxDataPortConfig()

After this we were able to see our encoder and put it into alternate mode. Hope this helps anyone struggling with the same issue!

3546, looking at your elevator code in Github, I don’t understand this code and I think there’s something I can learn here. Why isn’t this linear with the encoder reading vs elevator position?

 public double encoderToInch(){
        // return 2.98857 * getElevatorPosition() + 7.62804;
        return 
            0.000130884*Math.pow(getElevatorPosition(), 4) 
            -0.0067331*Math.pow(getElevatorPosition(), 3) 
            +0.118148*Math.pow(getElevatorPosition(), 2) 
            +2.30416*getElevatorPosition() 
            +8;
    }
","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-02-26T20:25:19.665Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":35,"readers_count":34,"score":12.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":491304,"topic_slug":"rev-through-bore-encoder-not-working-in-alternate-mode","display_username":"John Slagel","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56132,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/rev-through-bore-encoder-not-working-in-alternate-mode/491304/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3541839,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-02-26T20:52:43.301Z","cooked":"

It should in theory be linear, but after plotting points and relating encoder rotations to inches, we got a close but not linear graph. This could be because of human error measuring or other factors. We tested different regression lines to find which had an R^2 closest to 1. We also had a requirement of 8 inches off the ground is 0 rotations. Using a quartic regression better accommodated this requirement and fix our datapoints better.

It is possible this isn’t the way to go or we missed something, but we have had consistent results with it (other then mechanical failures with the elevator)
